gauzy: A gauzy object is one that is covered in a thin layer of material, such as gauze.
A gauzy surface is covered with a thin layer of material, such as gauze.
meshed: A meshed surface is made up of a series of small triangles.
The mesh material looks like a net or a screen.
cracked: A "cracked" thing can look like it has been hit with a blunt object and has a line running through it.
Cracked material may have sharp edges.
stratified: Stratified materials generally have a layered appearance, with each layer having a different composition.
A stratified texture is a type of sedimentary rock texture in which there are visible layers or streaks.
scaly: A scaly texture is usually dry, rough, and flaky.
The word "scaly" is used to describe a dry, flaky skin condition.
swirly: Swirly material is material with a lot of small, intricate patterns.
A "swirly" object may have a spiral or whorl shape.
perforated: A "perforated" texture has small holes in it.
A perforated surface has small holes in it.
pleated: A pleated surface has a series of ridges and valleys that resemble the folds of a pleated skirt or pair of pants.
A pleated texture has a series of small, parallel folds or creases.
flecked: A "flecked" surface has small, irregular pieces of another material mixed in with it.
A flecked thing looks like it has small pieces of something different sprinkled throughout it.
fibrous: A fibrous thing looks like a bundle of threads.
A fibrous texture looks stringy, like shreds of meat.
polka-dotted: A polka-dotted material has white dots on a colored background.
A "polka-dotted" pattern looks like a pattern of small dots.
chequered: A chequered thing has a pattern of light and dark squares.
A chequered thing has a pattern of light and dark squares.
blotchy: A blotchy thing usually looks like a rash or a bruise.
There is no definitive answer to this question as "blotchy" is a subjective term.
stained: A stained thing looks like it has a mark on it that cannot be removed.
A "stained" surface looks like it has been discolored by a substance.
crystalline: Crystalline textures are usually found in metamorphic rocks and are characterized by sharp, well-formed crystals.
A crystalline object is usually transparent or translucent, with a geometric shape.
porous: A "porous" object has many small holes or gaps in it.
A porous texture is a texture that is full of small holes.
banded: Banded material is a type of fabric that has been dyed or printed with stripes or other patterns that are of different colors.
A banded surface is a surface that has visible bands or stripes.
lacelike: Lace is a delicate fabric made of yarn or thread in an openwork pattern, typically used for trimming.
Lacelike material is typically very delicate and has a lot of small holes in it.
sprinkled: A sprinkler is a device used to apply water to an area in a controlled manner.
A sprinkled object typically has a light dusting of something on it.
bubbly: A "bubbly" object is typically spherical in shape and has a smooth, glossy surface.
A material that is bubbly would have a lot of small air pockets or gaps throughout.
lined: Lined material is one that has a second layer of fabric sewn on the inside.
Lined textures are made up of a series of parallel lines.
veined: A veined pattern typically features darker lines or streaks against a lighter background.
The word "veined" can describe a material that has lines or streaks running through it, or a material that is marbled with different colors.
bumpy: A "bumpy" surface has protrusions or indentations that make it uneven.
A "bumpy" pattern can look like a series of small hills or mountains.
paisley: Paisley material consists of curved shapes with swirling lines, similar to the design on a paisley tie.
A paisley pattern is a highly stylized representation of a feather, typically found in a teardrop shape.
potholed: A potholed texture looks like a series of depressions or holes in a surface.
A potholed pattern looks like a series of small, round depressions in the surface of a material.
waffled: A waffled object has a texture that resembles a waffle.
A waffled object has a texture that resembles a waffle.
pitted: A pitted surface looks like it has tiny craters or divots.
A pitted texture looks like a lot of small holes or depressions on a surface.
frilly: A "frilly" texture often looks like it has a lot of small wrinkles or creases in it.
A frilly thing looks like it has a lot of small, intricate details.
spiralled: A "spiralled" texture looks like a series of concentric circles or spiral shapes.
When looking at a "spiralled" material, it would appear to be winding its way around in a circular pattern.
knitted: A knitted object looks like a fabric made up of interlocking loops of yarn.
A knitted pattern looks like a series of interconnected loops.
grooved: "Grooved" material is characterized by having one or more grooves running along its length.
A grooved surface is a surface with a series of parallel lines running along it.
dotted: A dotted material has small dots all over it.
A dotted object has a pattern of small dots.
interlaced: Interlaced surfaces have a wavy, disorderly appearance.
A "interlaced" thing can look like a chain link fence.
crosshatched: The lines on a crosshatched object are drawn in opposite directions, usually at a 45 degree angle.
A crosshatched surface looks like a surface with a series of parallel lines intersecting at right angles.
wrinkled: Wrinkled material looks like it has wrinkles.
A wrinkled thing appears to have lines or creases on its surface.
smeared: "Smeared" material looks like it has been smeared or wiped across a surface.
A smeared texture looks like a streaky or blotchy texture.
striped: Striped material usually has alternating bands of color running horizontally or vertically.
A striped object is an object that has lines or stripes on it.
braided: A "braided" object has three or more strands that are interlaced together.
A braided pattern looks like a series of interwoven strands.
freckled: Freckled material can look like a material that has small brown spots on it.
Freckled material typically has small, dark spots on a light background.
cobwebbed: The term "cobwebbed" is often used to describe the appearance of a spider's web.
A "cobwebbed" object is covered in a thin layer of spider webs.
honeycombed: A honeycombed surface looks like a beehive, with a series of hexagonal cells.
A "honeycombed" object may have a hexagonal or octagonal shape, and is filled with small, empty spaces.
woven: The word "woven" typically refers to a fabric that is created by interlacing two sets of yarn or other material at right angles to each other.
A woven thing would look like something that is made out of a lot of small pieces of material that are all interconnected with each other.
matted: Matted material is usually tangled or tangled up.
Generally, matted material is clumped together, tangled, or otherwise stuck together in a way that makes it difficult to smooth out or separate.
zigzagged: Zigzagged material is material that has been bent or folded into a zigzag pattern.
A "zigzagged" pattern alternates between a peak and a trough, like the letter "Z".
marbled: A "marbled" thing is covered in swirls or streaks of color.
A marbled thing looks like it has been created by combining two different colors or materials together to produce a mottled effect.
studded: A studded thing has small metal or jeweled decorations on it.
A studded object has small, metal spikes sticking out of it.
grid: A grid pattern is a series of horizontal and vertical lines that intersect to form a series of squares.
A grid object is a rectangular array of cells.
